name: Draw 1D
tagline: Deep Recurrent Attentive Writer for 1D data
body:
# Deep Recurrent Attentive Writer for 1 dimensional data
This post takes our [implementation for DRAW](https://robromijnders.github.io/DRAW/) and rewrites them for 1 dimensional signals.

# Plots
The [UCR database](http://www.cs.ucr.edu/~eamonn/time_series_data/) supplies with applicable time series to show our implementation on. For this experiment, we chose the ECG5000 dataset. Note that the ECG's run from R-peak to R-peak.
![Example_ecg](https://github.com/RobRomijnders/DRAW_1D/blob/master/canvas/ecg5.gif?raw=True)

  * The __left__ column displays the original signal and the read bar
  * The __middle_ column displays the current Gaussians about to be written
  * The __right__ column displays the written signal plus the write bar

Every time-step, the network write to the canvas in the right columns. In this writing operation, we add a mixture of Gaussians to the canvas. Gaussians need only two parameters, which makes them suited for this task. The middle columns plots in _blue_ the five individual Gaussians. The _red_ curve is the summation of the five Gaussians. 

In the [original post](https://robromijnders.github.io/DRAW/) we discuss some context of the DRAW and refer to additional material. 

As always, I am curious to any comments and questions. Reach me at romijndersrob@gmail.com
